moves.1. e4: geniusacamel gives me the chance to avenge my loss. I decide to go back to an old favourite especially as I predict a French Defence after scouting his games.
moves.1... e6: Preparation rewarded. Part 2 of the plan retain the initiative even if it means sacking material.
moves.2. d4 d5 3. Nc3: 3.Nc3 is the most active move in this position I think. 3.Nd2 is more of a restraining black type of move and 3.e5 though gaining space can get stodgy whilst still allowing black counterplay
moves.3... Bb4: I guessed camelagenius would choose this most dynamic of variations,
moves.4. e5 c5 5. a3 Bxc3+ 6. bxc3 Ne7 7. Qg4: The most aggressive continuation and in line with my desire to seize the initiative. Here I was hoping to channel the spirit of Tal inspired by Game 1 1960 World Chess Championship Tal v. Botvinnik
moves.7... O-O: This surprised me. I was expecting/hoping for 7......Qc7 sacrificing the g7/h7 pawns for counterplay
moves.8. Bd3: 8.Nf3 is also popular but the move played is more direct with the B targeting the k-side.
moves.8... c4: 8.....Nbc6 and 8.....f5 are more usual and probably better.
moves.9. Bh6: Targeting the king and retaining the initiative
moves.9... Ng6: Forced but also getting rid of whites good white squared bishop.
moves.10. Bxg6 fxg6 11. Be3: I like this better than 11.Bd2 as it protects f2 though the B can become the target of a N on f5.
moves.12... Qe8: Providing protection along the e8/h6 diagonal
moves.13... gxh5 14. Rxh5 Ne7 15. Nf3: geniusacamel suggested that 15.Ne2 was an interesting alternative
moves.17. Qg3: Here I was tempted by 17.Rh5 offering to repeat positions. My opponent suggested that the position offered more than a draw for white so I played on.
moves.18. Nh2: Redirecting the knight towards g4 to put more pressure on blacks king
moves.19. Ng4 h6 20. O-O-O: ?? Blunder.I was hoping to get more pieces into the attac at the cost of a rook sac.20.Nf6 should have been played. After 20.......Rxf6 21.exf Qxf6 22.Re5 I didn't think white had anything really special so I went for the R sac. I should have analysed the line furter as white has quite a good game
moves.20... hxg5 21. Bxg5 Nf5 22. Qf4: 22.Qh3 was a little better though black is still winninh
moves.22... b5 23. Rh1 Kf7 24. Bf6 g5: Missed this. Now white is kaput.
moves.25. Bxg5 Rh8 26. Rxh8 Qxh8 27. Bf6 Qh1+: white resigns a rook down. Once again frustrated by geniusacamel who gave chances in the opening/middlegame which once again failed to capitalise on

opening: French (C19), Winawer, advance, poisoned pawn variation
